comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Like the other pictures near this in sequence, this is on board E.C. Benedict's yacht Oneida.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: According to the June 1916 issue of The Rudder books.google.com/books?id=nsU6AAAAMAAJ&pg=PA265 these people were on board the "new" Oneida for a trip to South America beginning on April 24, 1913. The trip was known as the "honeymoon trip" because the Hoyts and the Sinclairs were newly married. This article suggests the first man is Edward Beers (not Beens)

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: A similar photo was printed in The San Francisco call., May 04, 1913, Image 79 (the first man named Edwin Beers).

comment.author: 33593953@N02
comment._content: Thanks for the added confirmation! We'll adjust and add information when we next update the description.
